intro: Randia myristicoides, commonly known as the sweet myristica, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces dark, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed, often used in traditional medicine. Its essential oils are valued for their fragrance and potential therapeutic properties. Randia myristicoides thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
